meanings.sent1: She carefully unbandaged the cut on her arm.
meanings.sent2: The nurse will unbandage the wound before applying a new bandage.
meanings.sent3: As she tried to unbandage the wound, the bandage got stuck on her sleeve!
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to unbandage old wounds, reopening painful memories.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight seemed to unbandage the hidden scars on her skin.

meanings.definition: Reveal or expose (something previously covered or hidden).
meanings.sent1: The magician unbandaged the mysterious box to reveal a dove inside.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist carefully unbandaged the ancient artifact for further examination.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party was ruined when the guest accidentally unbandaged the decorations too early.
meanings.sent4: Her smile unbandaged the sadness in his heart, bringing joy to his day.
meanings.sent5: The storm unbandaged the hidden treasure buried beneath the sand.
